items.title: Afcon to be held every four years from 2028
items.summary: In a huge change to the football calendar, the Africa Cup of Nations will be held every four years from 2028, switching away from biennial finals.

items.title: Iroko proves National credentials again with Ascot triumph
items.summary: Iroko maintained his position at the head of the Grand National betting with a fine victory in the Howden Graduation Chase at Ascot.

items.title: '100 per cent it is!' | Mike Dean reacts to Newcastle penalty claim
items.summary: Mike Dean reacts as Newcastle are denied a penalty in their Premier League clash against Chelsea.

items.title: Adeyemi wil meteen douchen na wissel en krijgt boete: 'Dat hoort niet'
items.summary: Karim Adeyemi heeft zich opnieuw niet populair gemaakt bij Borussia Dortmund. De vleugelaanvaller wilde na zijn wissel tegen Borussia M√∂nchengladbach meteen gaan douchen, maar stuitte onderweg naar de kleedkamer op Sebastian Kehl. 'Hij krijgt straf.'

items.title: Startende spits FC Utrecht levert niet
items.summary: Cijferman Bart Frouws vertelt je in Scorebordjournalistiek wat er opvalt richting speelronde 17 van de Eredivisie. Samen met Sjoerd Keizer bespreekt hij deze keer de spitsen van FC Utrecht.

items.title: Arteta on Arsenal future: I have to earn new deal
items.summary: Mikel Arteta has hinted he could stay at Arsenal beyond his current contract but suggested he would have to earn any new deal.

items.title: Wrexham boss defends keeper after derby blunder
items.summary: Phil Parkinson defended "colossus" Arthur Okonkwo after the Wrexham goalkeeper's 90th-minute howler gifted Swansea a 2-1 victory in a hard-fought Welsh derby.

items.title: USMNT's Adams (torn MCL) out up to 3 months
items.summary: United States international Tyler Adams will be out for up to three months after tearing a medial collateral ligament, Bournemouth coach Andoni Iraola said Friday.

items.title: PSG GK fractured hand during shootout heroics
items.summary: Paris Saint-Germain goalkeeper Matvey Safonov has been left with a fractured hand following his penalty shootout heroics to win the Intercontinental Cup.

items.title: Manchester United target R√∫ben Neves and Conor Gallagher as January signings
items.summary: Antoine Semenyo thought to favour move to Liverpool Neves would cost around ¬£20m but wages may be issue Manchester United are monitoring Al-Hilal‚Äôs R√∫ben Neves and Atl√©tico Madrid‚Äôs Conor Gallagher as potential January signings to strengthen Ruben Amorim‚Äôs squad. Bournemouth‚Äôs Tyler Adams is also of interest but any deal for the American is not likely until the close season. United are also vying with Liverpool and Manchester City to sign Antoine Semenyo from Bournemouth in early January but the forward is thought to favour joining Liverpool, with City his second choice, so Amorim faces a fight to convince him. items.title: Ousmane Demb√©l√© quietly becomes the main man after long journey to the top
items.summary: The Frenchman, who has been named the best male footballer in the world by the Guardian, has benefitted from PSG‚Äôs focus on the team rather than individuals What makes a good player great, and a great player the best? This question has been occupying me since 2014, when the Guardian first asked me to contribute to its inaugural Next Generation feature. My job was to look for a France-based talent born in 1997 who could go on to have a stellar career. After a great deal of research, I narrowed it down from my shortlist of five by asking questions not about the players‚Äô football ability, but about other attributes: resilience, adaptability, decision-making, creativity, work ethic, response to feedback and willingness to learn. Qualities we cannot see, and are harder to measure. Continue reading...
